intro: Sulettaria polycarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited sulettaria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Its fruits are dry and schizocarpic, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature. Sulettaria polycarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
